thread.title: Global Travel Group welcomes 31 new members
thread.title_full: Global Travel Group welcomes 31 new members

title: Global Travel Group welcomes 31 new members
text:
Global Travel Group welcomes 31 new members 11 August 2015 Save 
A total of 31 new members have joined the Global Travel Group since the start of the year. 
Managing director Andy Stark said the new members comprised of 20 homeworkers and 11 high street agencies, bringing the total number of members to 362 across the UK. 
He added: “Over the past 18 months we have worked hard at improving our technology, training and marketing proposition and we are pleased to see the benefits that this is providing to those in the travel industry. 
“With more potential members in the pipeline it’s great to see both existing agents and those new to travel looking to us to support their business success.” 
New members included Nantwich Travel in Cheshire whose owner David Shearer said: “The support from the Global membership team has been great. The consortium’s marketing offering, selling tools and competitive supplier partnerships are already making a huge difference to our success.” 
The new business success follows the creation of The Global Travel Group’s Global Advisory Panel (GAP) in March 2015, which meets on a quarterly basis to discuss member issues.
